message.content:
cs.CE, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Computational Engineering, as it presents a novel data-based approach to turbulence modeling for Large Eddy Simulation (LES) using artificial neural networks. It also involves the use of convolution filters and the prediction of non-linear mappings, which are common techniques in machine learning and artificial intelligence, making it likely to also belong to the sub-categories of Machine Learning (cs.LG), Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE), and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper involves the use of data-driven models, which is a common theme in the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI).
